label: Description
value: A dark blue ground with stylized images of a bundle of dried abalone, a bag of money, sea anemones and a flaming magic jewel in blues, tans, pinks and green.

label: Physical description
value: Block-printed on joined sheets of handmade paper

label: Credit line
value: Museum purchase from Smithsonian Institution Collections Acquisition Program Fund

label: Description
value: A square bedcover with a wide border on all sides, a central medallion and smaller medallions in each corner, with an allover floral lattice ground. The central medallion contains a double-headed eagle and the corner medallions each contain a fantastic beast.  The outer borders are linked repeats of an S-shaped floral vine.  All executed in light gold color flax thread on an off-white ground.

label: Physical description
value: Medium: linen foundation, flax embroidery thread Technique: embroidered on plain weave

label: Dimensions
value: Warp x Weft: 268 x 247.5 cm (8 ft. 9 1/2 in. x 8 ft. 1 7/16 in.)

label: Credit line
value: Gift of Phyllis Henriquez Hecht Gammon and Edward Henriquez Hecht in memory of Mrs. Anita Henriquez Hecht and museum purchase through bequest of Mrs. John Innes Kane

label: Notes
value: A square bedcover with a wide border on all sides, a central medallion and smaller medallions in each corner, with an allover floral lattice ground. All executed in light gold color flax thread on an off-white ground.

label: Description
value: Half trompe l'oeil ceiling rosette from decor "Renaissance". Printed in grisaille, mauve and gold.

label: Description
value: Floral border printed two across. Printed in colors on cream-colored paper.

label: Description
value: Pompeian-style motifs within medallions, printed three borders across the width. A diamond-shape medallion containing a seated winged figure alternates with a round medallion containing a winged horse or griffon. Between each of these motifs is a small urn in a rectangular framework. Printed in colors on a white ground.

label: Description
value: Vertical border printed two across with neoclassical-style shell, volutes and rosettes framed within egg and dart motifs. Borders have shadows printed on opposite sides of motifs. Golds, white and gray on gray background.

label: Description
value: Faux aqua-colored marble brick or ashlar block pattern. A framework of crossed ribbons, acanthus diamonds and pyramid bosses encases each simulated marble block.

label: Description
value: Classical design, with passementerie and architectural molding, including tassels, swag rope twist and lion head medallions.  Printed in seven colors including gold, orange and blue on yellow ocher ground.

label: Credit line
value: Gift of The Museum at The Fashion Institute of Technology

label: Description
value: Birds and flowers in white bands.  "Bird of Paradise" document.

label: Credit line
value: Gift of The Museum at The Fashion Institute of Technology

label: Description
value: Arabesque design. Central motif of large bouqet of flowers in urn. Below and in front of this sits a ewer on a lambrequin. Rope swags and tassles suspended from rod which supports lambrequin.  Rose swag around lambrequin. Above the bouquet sits a cameo, with an urn on a balustrade against a pink background. The cameo is surrounded by a beaded framework. Printed in polychrome on a light blue-green ground.

label: Credit line
value: Gift of The Museum at The Fashion Institute of Technology

label: Description
value: Original document for "Diamond Damask". Blue diamonds in floral framework with brown striped overprinting. Printed on yellow ground.

label: Credit line
value: Gift of The Museum at The Fashion Institute of Technology

label: Description
value: Floral bouquets, with foliate swags and scrolls, printed in white on blue ground. A lacey white stripe runs vertically through the center of the paper.

label: Credit line
value: Gift of The Museum at The Fashion Institute of Technology

label: Description
value: Blue rose alternating with a blue rosette, in tile format. Printed on blue ground.

value: Gift of The Museum at The Fashion Institute of Technology

label: Description
value: 2 different designs mounted on support. Narrow band of blue foliate sprigs on left edge, with wider band of American flag ribbons forming guilloche design. Another narrow band of blue foliate sprigs, with wider band containing American flags, cannon, shield and drum, alternating with eagle holding arrows and laurel sprigs. Printed in red, blue and green on off-white ground.

label: Provenance
value: This original document was found lining an old cupboard in General Trumbull's house. Note: Jonathan Trumbull Sr. was governor of Connecticut 1769-1784; Jonathan Trumbull, Jr. was governor of CT 1798-1809; John Trumbull, painter of American Revolution b. 1756-d. 1843.  Connecticut did not have a governor named Lathrop.

label: Credit line
value: Gift of The Museum at The Fashion Institute of Technology

label: Description
value: Pillar and arch design, featuring a memorial to George Washington. A bust of Washington is centered on a pyramid upon a pedestal. Trophies of war sit upon the plinth, including cannon cannon balls, drum, and flag. Many symbols of the Masons are contained in this design, including the all-seeing eye and the checkerboard floor. The pedestal sits between two columns. To the left are floral vines forming a pointed arch.

label: Credit line
value: Gift of The Museum at The Fashion Institute of Technology
